title: In the case of a plot, surrounded on all sides by other plots, i
clause_text: In the case of a plot, surrounded on all sides by other plots, i.e. a land- locked plot which has no access to any street or road, the Commissioner may require access through an adjoining plot or plots which shall, as far as possible, be nearest to the public street. The cost of land acquisition and development of such access shall be borne by the owner of land-locked plot and subject to other conditions prescribed by the Commissioner. Alternatively, if the owner of the adjoining plot, which is accessible from a public street, is willing to provide right o access to such land-locked plot then the same may be permitted from the required marginal side open space of the building on such adjoining plots.
